skill.author: DataKnifeAI

security_audit.summary: This skill provides surveillance monitoring capabilities through MCP tools that connect to UniFi Protect systems. While the skill itself is documentation-only, the underlying MCP server requires network access to surveillance systems and handles security-sensitive camera data. The Docker configuration shows proper security practices with non-root user execution.

medium_findings.title: Surveillance System Access Required
medium_findings.description: The skill requires access to UniFi Protect surveillance systems via API keys and network connections. This grants access to camera feeds, recordings, and security event data which could be sensitive.

medium_findings.title: External Harbor Registry Dependency
medium_findings.description: Docker configuration uses external Harbor registry (harbor.dataknife.net) for container images, creating a supply chain dependency that could be compromised.

low_findings.title: SSL Verification Can Be Disabled
low_findings.description: Configuration allows disabling SSL certificate verification via UNIFI_SKIP_SSL_VERIFY environment variable, which could enable man-in-the-middle attacks.

content.user_title: Monitor UniFi Protect surveillance cameras and security events
content.value_statement: Keep your surveillance system secure and operational with AI-powered monitoring. Get instant insights into camera status, review security events, and ensure comprehensive coverage.
actual_capabilities: Monitor camera status and connectivity in real-time
Review surveillance events with filtering by type
Track system health metrics and storage usage
limitations: Requires UniFi Protect system with API access enabled
Cannot access camera video streams directly
Limited to monitoring and reporting functions

use_cases.title: Daily surveillance system checks
use_cases.description: Quickly verify all cameras are online, review overnight events, and check system health metrics

use_cases.title: Coverage verification and reporting
use_cases.description: Ensure critical areas have proper camera coverage and generate compliance reports

use_cases.title: Troubleshoot camera connectivity issues
use_cases.description: Identify offline cameras, check network connectivity, and monitor system performance

prompt_templates.title: Basic camera check
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me all cameras and their current status. Are any offline?

prompt_templates.title: Event review
prompt_templates.prompt: Get surveillance events from the last 24 hours. Show motion detection alerts first.

prompt_templates.title: System health check
prompt_templates.prompt: Check the Protect system health including storage usage, recording status, and any warnings.

prompt_templates.title: Coverage analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze camera coverage for the building perimeter. Identify any potential blind spots.

best_practices: Check camera status daily to catch issues early
Monitor storage usage proactively to prevent data loss
Review security events regularly for incident response
anti_patterns: Don't ignore offline cameras - investigate immediately
Avoid checking only during emergencies - establish routine monitoring
Don't rely solely on automated alerts - perform manual verification

faq.question: What UniFi Protect version is required?
faq.answer: UniFi Protect 3.x or later with API access enabled is required for full functionality.

faq.question: Can I view live camera feeds?
faq.answer: This skill monitors status and events but doesn't provide direct video stream access.

faq.question: How do I get API credentials?
faq.answer: Generate an API key from your UniFi Controller under Settings > System > Advanced > API.

faq.question: Is my surveillance data secure?
faq.answer: The skill connects directly to your UniFi system. No data is sent to external services.

faq.question: What if cameras show as offline?
faq.answer: Check network connectivity, power supply, and UniFi Protect service status.

faq.question: How does this compare to UniFi's mobile app?
faq.answer: This provides AI-powered analysis and reporting beyond basic status monitoring.
